Monday, September 22

New Approaches Summit: NYC 2025 - 4th Annual Date
=================================================

**2025 New Approaches - UN Week Summit**

**44** followers

By**New Approaches**

**44** followers

**2 years** on Eventbrite 📈

Follow

Follow

Date and time
-------------

Monday, September 22 · 8am - 7pm EDT

Location
--------

Harvard Club of New York City

 35 West 44th Street New York, NY 10036

Get directions

Refund Policy
-------------

No Refunds

About this event
----------------

****Eventbrite Ticket Registration****

### ****2025 New Approaches to Tobacco Control & Harm Reduction:****

### _****Saving Lives in the 21st Century****_

Join us on Monday, September 22nd, at the Harvard Club of New York City for the ****fourth annual New Approaches to Tobacco Control & Harm Reduction summit****, held alongside the start of United Nations General Assembly (UNGA80) and climate week.

This one-day event brings together a diverse group of experts from various sectors (including government, public health, policy, advocacy, regulatory, technology, investment, and the scientific community) to discuss and address key US and global issues and opportunities related to tobacco control and harm reduction—****united by a********common goal:********to accelerate an end to smoking-related deaths and improve global health.****

#### Program Updates:

2025 programming is in development. View the 2024 [agenda](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I74ogKcXwYBDNUaqp55Rmu_4r-cQSKBF/view "https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I74ogKcXwYBDNUaqp55Rmu_4r-cQSKBF/view"), [speaker biographies](https://www.newapproaches.nyc/#speakers "https://www.newapproaches.nyc/#speakers"), and find more information about New Approaches on the Website here: [newapproaches.nyc](http://www.newapproaches.nyc/ "http://www.newapproaches.nyc")

#### Hybrid In-Person / Virtual Livestream Registration Access:

In-person and zoom livestream is available. If you are unable to attend in person, select the Livestream option at checkout to register to watch the New Approaches 2025 live sessions via ZOOM in real-time from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM Eastern Daylight Time (EDT).

If you have questions about ticket registration, please email: events@newapproaches.nyc

#### Group Ticket Registration:

To inquire about discounts for 5 tickets or more, please contact events@newapproaches.nyc

#### Get Involved:

For inquiries about attending, program participation, sponsorship opportunities, and other ways to get involved, please contact events@newapproaches.nyc.

### ---

### About New Approaches:

New Approaches is an independent global forum on science and policy held annually during United Nations General Assembly week and Climate week in New York City. As a neutral convener, New Approaches hosts programming developed by summit chairs and speakers. Views and statements by speakers are their own and diverse perspectives are encouraged.

The summit is open to all stakeholders committed to working together to find solutions to end smoking and make a global health impact.

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

What is the New Approaches to tobacco control & harm reduction forum?

The annual event investigates how new approaches to policy innovation and technological innovation complement each other in reducing global tobacco dependence to prevent combustible tobacco-related deaths.

When and where does the forum take place?

The one-day event is hosted annually during the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) and climate week in September. The 2025 fourth annual event takes place on Monday, September 22, 2025 in New York City from 8AM-7PM EDT. In-person and virtual livestream options are available at check-out.

Who should attend?

NAC is open to multi-sector professionals, researchers, government, health experts, medical inst., industry, consumer advocates, media, and individuals interested in proactive and practical harm reduction solutions. Attendees from various fields unite together to contribute in meaningful ways.

What topics/themes are covered?

The sessions cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to, the science of harm reduction, regulatory approaches to tobacco control, technological innovations, the impacts on public health, finance, and the relationship between tobacco harm reduction and the United Nations SDGs.

What networking opportunities will there be?

NAC provides ample networking opportunities. Attendees will have the chance to connect with experts, researchers, industry professionals, and policymakers during breaks, networking sessions, and social events. These discussions foster collaboration and facilitate knowledge exchange.

Will there be poster or oral presentation opportunities? 

Future opportunities for both poster and oral presentations. Abstract submission guidelines and deadlines will be available on the event website. This allows for researchers/ professionals to share their work, findings, and innovative approaches related to tobacco control and harm reduction.

Is there an opportunity for sponsors/partners?

The forum welcomes sponsors who meet the criteria and wish to support and showcase their products, services, or initiatives aligned with the event. If you are interested in sponsorship opportunities, email events@newapproaches.nyc for further information.

Is there an opportunity for media and press engagement?

Yes, journalists are encouraged and welcome to attend at no cost. If you are a journalist interested in obtaining a media accreditation, learn more, or to schedule on-site interviews with select speakers, panelists, or the organizers please email events@newapproaches.nyc.

Will the summit sessions be recorded or available online?

This is an in person event and livestream is available (session times from 8:45AM-5:30PM EDT). Post-event, recorded sessions or online access may vary, the organizers aim to provide access to select materials. Further information will be communicated on the event website and its official channels.

How do I register and what is the cost to attend?

Early registration is recommended as space is limited to 150 attendees. Pricing tiers range from $100.00 to $1600.00 depending on your professional delegate category. In person ticket includes welcome breakfast, lunch, refreshment breaks, and a networking cocktail reception.

Are there accommodations and travel arrangements provided? 

Attendees are responsible for their own accommodations and travel arrangements. The event organizers may provide information on recommended hotels nearby the venue in midtown, but it is advisable to book well in advance given New York City is peak-season adjacent to UNGA activities.
